definition: richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: He won't ask me to wear jewels and glitter.
sentences.chinese: 他从不要求我穿金戴银。

sentences.english: An ape is an ape, though decked with gold.
sentences.chinese: 尽管穿金戴银，仍然是猿猴。

definition: brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
